verbose_text: In support of these current studies, a previous study demonstrated that transcranial magnetic stimulation, which is well known to potentiate neuronal activity, inhibited toxic effects of 3-nitropropionic acid (3-NPA) (protein / lipid oxidations, reduction in activities of catalase, GSH peroxidase and succinate dehydrogenase, and GSH deficiency) and rescued the striatal neuronal loss in rats [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: 3-nitropropionic acid (3-NPA) (protein/lipid oxidations, reduction in activities of catalase, GSH
